Schools Examination and Assessment Council The National Curriculum Council (NCC) was one of three bodies created under the Education Reform Act 1988 to help in implementing the national curriculum and its assessment arrangements. The others were the Curriculum Council for Wales (CCW) and the Schools Examination and Assessment Council (SEAC) for England and Wales. The National Curriculum Council, together with SEAC and CCW, were wound up by the Education Act 1993.Source: {TNA|https://discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/details/r/C136} ac... DFE
Social and Emotional Aspects of Learning SEAL is a comprehensive, whole-school approach to promoting the social and emotional skills that underpin effective learning, positive behaviour, regular attendance, staff effectiveness and the emotional health and well-being of all who learn and work in schools.Source: {GOV.UK|https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/social-and-emotional-aspects-of-learning-seal-programme-in-secondary-schools-national-evaluation} accessed 2015-06-11 DFE

SEN coordinators The member of staff of a school who has responsibility for coordinating Special Educational Needs (SEN) provision within that school. In a small school the headteacher or deputy may take on this role. In larger schools there may be an SEN coordinating team. DFE

Senior Librarians DFE
Special Educational Needs Support Service Special Educational Needs Support Service (SENSS) are a range of specialist support services provided by Local Authorities which are available to schools to provide advice and expertise and, in some cases, to work with individual pupils where a specific need has been shown to exist. All of these services are directly available to schools and some, particularly the Educational Welfare Service, Portage and the Educational Psychology Service also work directly with parents. DFE

Sustainable Farming Incentive The Sustainable Farming Incentive (SFI) is the first of 3 new environmental schemes being introduced under the Agricultural Transition Plan. The other 2 schemes are Local Nature Recovery and Landscape Recovery. SFI aims to help farmers manage land in a way that improves food production and is more environmentally sustainable. Single Housing Infrastructure Fund DLUHC
Strategic Housing Land Availability Assessment A Strategic Housing Land Availability Assessment (SHLAA) is a technical exercise to determine the quantity and suitability of land potentially available for housing development. It is a required part of the evidence base needed for the preparation of a Local Plan (as specified in the National Planning Policy Framework, para. 159). The Mayor carries out a London-wide SHLAA to inform the London Plan as it determines the borough housing targets that form a key part of the Plan. DLUHC
Society of Heads of Independent Schools The Society of Heads of Independent Schools (SHMIS) is an Association of Headmasters and Headmistresses of just over 100 well-established Independent schools. It is one of the constituent organisations of the Independent Schools Council. It was previously called the Society of Headmasters and Headmistresses of Independent Schools hence the 'M' in its abbreviated form which is still retained. SHMIS was formed in 1961 when a group of Heads decided they needed a forum in which to share ideas and... DFE

School Infrastructure and Access Division Year(s) active (where known): 2017-2019 DFE
Social Impact Bonds Social impact bonds (SIBs) are designed to help reform public service delivery. SIBs improve the social outcomes of publicly funded services by making funding conditional on achieving results. Investors pay for the project at the start, and then receive payments based on the results achieved by the project.Source: {GOV.UK|https://www.gov.uk/social-impact-bonds} accessed 2015-06-11 DFE

Strategically important and vulnerable subjects The SIVS advisory group was set up in January 2005 to identify strategically important and vulnerable subjects and the principles on which to base intervention. The group reconvened in 2012 to review the data and information relating to the sustainability of subjects, and to provide advice and recommendations to the HEFCE Board regarding the identification, monitoring and support for SIVS.Source: {HEFCE|http://www.hefce.ac.uk/kess/subjects/ag/} accessed 2016-07-22 DFE
Subject Knowledge Enhancement Schools and Initial Teacher Training (ITT) providers who are allocated training places in mathematics, physics, computing, chemistry, languages or design and technology can request subject knowledge enhancement (SKE) funding to support their recruitment. SKE courses are designed to help applicants increase their subject knowledge so they can train to teach their chosen subject.Source: {GOV.UK|https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/subject-knowledge-enhancement-course-directory} accessed 2... Student Loans Company The Student Loans Company (SLC) is a non-profit making Government-owned organisation set up in 1989 to provide loans and grants to students in universities and colleges in the UK. The company plays a central role in supporting the Higher Education (HE) and Further Education (FE) sectors by: making timely and accurate payments of maintenance grants and loans to learners; and ensuring timely and accurate payments of tuition fee loans to HE and FE providers. We do this by working with the Depart... DFE

Strategic Leadership of ICT SLICT (Strategic Leadership of ICT) is a unique programme designed by head teachers for head teachers; it focuses on the strategic role of heads in leading and developing Information and Communications Technology (ICT). Developed in partnership by NCSL and BECTA, the programme engages school leaders in developing and implementing their vision for learning in their school.Source: The Knowledge accessed 2019-05-30 DFE

Science Learning Partnerships Our Science Learning Partnerships (SLPs) combine local expertise in teaching and learning in science, facilitating CPD, and providing school-to-school support. They are led by local teaching school alliances, schools and colleges with excellence in science, higher education institutions, and other local partners with cutting-edge expertise in science.Source: {STEM Learning|https://www.stem.org.uk/science-learning-partnerships} accessed 2019-12-23 DFE

Social Mobility Commission On 01 April 2021 the Social Mobility Commission (SMC) moved to the Cabinet Office's Equalities Hub. It had been an Arm's Length Body of the DfE since 2012. The department will continue to have a close relationship with the SMC, given the important role education plays in improving social mobility and securing good opportunities for all.Source: Intranet news 2021-03-30 DFE

Spiritual, moral, social and cultural development All schools have a duty to actively promote the fundamental British values of democracy, the rule of law, individual liberty, and mutual respect and tolerance of those with different faiths and beliefs. This strengthened guidance is designed to tighten up the standards on pupil welfare to improve safeguarding, and the standards on spiritual, moral, social and cultural development of pupils to strengthen the barriers to extremism. Statement of Comparability for the Early Years Sector The UK NARIC Statement of Comparability for the Early Years Sector (SOCEYS) has been developed in collaboration with NCTL. From 1st September 2014 onwards, in line with a change in the NCTLs requirements, UK NARIC will be offering two different SOCEYS services, which are determined by the comparable academic level of the overseas qualification.Source: {UK NARIC|http://ecctis.co.ukaric/individuals/Compare%20Qualifications/Comparability%20for%20Early%20Years%20Sector.aspx} accessed 2015-06-11 DFE

Single Point Of Contact Civil Service Wide
Single Point of Failure Often refers to a single system, machine or person without which/whom a process/system/company will grind to a halt.e.g. a sysadmin who is the only one who knows the password to the mail server, who then gets hit by a bus. Not Limited to CS
Strategic Place Partnership Strategic Place Partnerships (SPPs) are a place-based approach to drive ambition and develop a credible pipeline in places focussed on delivering the 300k target. They will support accelerated delivery of homes through a range of delivery models, such as development corporations, new towns and urban regeneration, funded predominately through NHBF Land & Infrastructure. https://www.london.gov.uk/sites/default/files/2017_london_strategic_housing_land_availability_assessment_0.pdf DLUHC

Spending Review/Spending Round A spending review or occasionally comprehensive spending review is a governmental process in the United Kingdom carried out by HM Treasury to set firm expenditure limits and, through public service agreements, define the key improvements that the public can expect from these resources. Society for Research into Higher Education The Society for Research into Higher Education is a UK-based international learned society concerned to advance understanding of higher education, especially through the insights, perspectives and knowledge offered by systematic research and scholarship. The Society aims to be the leading international society in the field, as to both the support and the dissemination of research. Schools Recruitment Service The Schools Recruitment Service (SRS) has been established to provide a faster, more efficient and standardised application system to recruit all permanent teaching and support staff in England. It was launched on 20 October 2009, although candidates were able to register from the summer. The contract for delivering SRS has been awarded to Tribal. It aims to save up to 30 million annually if all schools in England sign up with huge savings in time; administration; and the cost of re-advertisi... DFE

Secondary Schools Examinations Council The Secondary Schools Examinations Council (SSEC) was set up by the Board of Education on 12 September 1917 (Circular 1010) to assist in the introduction of a new scheme for the better organisation of examinations in secondary schools. These were School Certificate and Higher School Certificate. It was chaired by Rev William Temple with representatives of the examining bodies, the Teachers Registration Council, and local authority organisations. The Council produced a number of small reports ... DFE

We prefer they work with other schools in their area to raise standards more widely.Source: {GOV.UK|https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/selective-schools-expansion-fund} accessed 2019-02-18 DFE

Small Sites Fund For public land owners or local authorities that are struggling to get building on land in their area, the Â£630 million Small Sites Fund will provide grant funding to speed up getting the right infrastructure in place to support home building on stalled small sites to provide the homes their communities need. DLUHC
School Standards and Framework Act 1998 The School Standards and Framework Act 1998 was introduced by the Department for Education and Employment and received royal assent on 20 July 1998. It introduced measures to raise standards of school education; created a new framework of Maintained schools (publicly-funded schools); strengthened and clarified the role of Local Authorities (LAs); made provision for increased parental involvement in education; and clarified legislation on school admissions and complaints.Source: The Knowledge ... School Teachers Review Body The STRB was established under the terms of the School Teachers' Pay and Conditions Act 1991 to report to the Prime Minister and to the Secretary of State for Education on the statutory pay and conditions of school teachers in England and Wales. Its legal status was subsequently continued by the Education Act 2002. Its recommendations cover the duties and working time of school teachers, as well as their remuneration. The Government has undertaken to implement the recommendations of all pay r... DFE

the programming framework used to create a variety of HMCTS systems SUPS comes in different flavours. MCOL is written against SUPS 15, which is implemented in J2EE and the Java Spring framework. PCOL chose to use an older version, SUPS9, which has significant performance issues.SUPS is also sometimes used as shorthand for a contract which has Juror, Familyman and Caseman inside it. MoJ
System Usability Scale The System Usability Scale (SUS) provides a â€œquick and dirtyâ€, reliable tool for measuring the usability. It consists of a 10 item questionnaire with five response options for respondents. MoJ

Trends in Mathematics and Science Study The Trends in International Mathematics and Science Study (TIMSS) is a collaborative project between the International Association for the Evaluation of Educational Achievement (IEA), national governments and the TIMSS & PIRLS International Study Centre at Boston College. TIMMS collects data at international grades four and eight (Years 5 and 9 respectively in England). Within each country: 170 schools (including independent) from each grade(year) are randomly selected to participate Within e... DFE
Teachers' International Professional Development The Teachers' International Professional Development (TIPD) programme was introduced in May 2000. The programme provides opportunities for teachers in England to develop their teaching skills, by experiencing alternative practice in a number of key themes through short-term international study visits. Such visits also aim to create valuable international links between schools, facilitating international school partnerships and information sharing on a global level. The Programme provides 2580... Transnational education Transnational education (TNE) is education delivered in a country other than the country in which the awarding institution is based, e.g. students based in country Y studying for a degree from a university in country Z.Source: {Universities UK|https://www.universitiesuk.ac.uk/International/heglobal/Pages/what-is-transnational-education.aspx} accessed 2019-12-24 DFE

Teenage Pregnancy Independent Advisory Group The Teenage Pregnancy Independent Advisory Group (TPIAG) was set up in 2000 to advise the Government on the Teenage Pregnancy Strategy and to monitor its implementation. The Government announced on October 14th, 2010 that it would be closed down. The strategy aims to Halve the rate of conceptions to under-18s by 2010. Teaching Regulation Agency 01 April 2018 - The Teaching Regulation Agency (TRA) is an executive agency of the Department for Education (DfE). The purpose of the agency is to take action on receipt of allegations of serious teacher misconduct and to support employers, schools and headteachers with safeguarding responsibilities. It provides employers with access to the database of qualified teachers (DQT) in order for them to complete pre-recruitment checks to ensure that they are employing teachers who are not prohibite... Technology Strategy Board Innovate UK (formerly the Technology Strategy Board). Its role is to stimulate technology-enabled innovation in the areas which offer the greatest scope for boosting UK growth and productivity. Promotes, supports and invests in technology research, development and commercialisation. Training Standards Council The Training Standards Council (TSC) was the regulator for employment training standards and practice. It was a private limited company, based in Oxford, incorporated on 29 August 1997 and dissolved on 5 April 2004. The government's plans to reform post-16 education and training outside universities in England, outlined in the White Paper Learning to Succeed, demonstrated its commitment to work-based training and led to the provision of post-16 learning being merged under a new national body,... Teaching school hubs Over one thousand schools are set to receive expert support from some of the countrys highest performing schools as the Department for Education announces six new Teaching School Hubs today (7 January [2020]). Schools will benefit from a three-year programme of support, with each of the six successful schools acting as a regional hub and will receive funding to support between 200 to 300 other schools in the local area. This will give struggling schools direct access to the expertise from sch... DFE
Technology Schools Initiative Source: The Knowledge accessed 2019-04-17 DFE
Transatlantic School Innovation Alliance Transatlantic School Innovation Alliance (TSIA) is a partnership designed to improve teaching and learning, and urban leadership through the creation of a network of schools in the UK and US. The goal is to blend the ideas and strategies from educators in the two countries with relevant research, and to design study and disseminate better ways of working. TSIA was piloted in 2006-07 and started fully in 2007-08 in and involves eight (rising to 12) schools from London. The partnership extended... DFE

Transforming Youth Work Development Fund Transforming Youth Work Development Fund (TYWDF) was launched in 2002 with the intention of providing Local Authority youth services with additional funding to enhance the quality and capacity of youth work. This Fund has since become the Transforming Youth Work Performance Improvement Fund (TYWPIF). Aims of the fund 10 million was pledged by Ministers for each of 2003-04, 2004-05 and 2005-06 for the youth work programme. The key aims of the TYWDF were to: Support the implementation of Youth ... DFE
Transforming Youth Work Performance Improvement Fund The Transforming Youth Work Performance Improvement Fund (TYWPIF) is the successor to the Transforming Youth Work Development Fund (TYWDF). It was managed by Government Offices on behalf of the Department. The TYWPIF carries forward the TYWDF agenda but also asks for youth services to focus resources on work around achieving performance measures. Priorities for the fund are: To support youth services in the planning and managing of performance indicators Help in the implementation of the Yout... DFE
Activities for Young People Programme The Activities for Young People Programme for 16-year-olds, also known as the u-project, was aimed at young people in England who were coming to the end of compulsory education (at the end of school year 11), with no real idea of what they wanted to do next. Those young people were more likely than others of drifting out of learning and into long-term disaffection. The aim of the u-project was to aid the transition from secondary school to adult life, by providing a structured programme of ch... DFE

Universities Council for the Education of Teachers The Universities Council for the Education of Teachers acts as a national forum for the discussion of matters relating to the education of teachers and professional educators, and to the study of education in the university sector and contributes to the formulation of policy in these fields. Its members are UK universities involved in teacher education, and a number of colleges of higher education in the university sector.Source: {UCET|http://www.ucet.ac.uk/} accessed 2016-07-20 DFE

Universities and Colleges Information Systems Association UCISA is the Universities and Colleges Information Systems Association, established 1 April 1993. It promotes excellence in the application of information systems and services in support of teaching, learning, research and administration in higher and further education.Source: {UCISA website|http://www.ucisa.ac.uk/about.aspx} accessed 2015-06-11 DFE
University of Cambridge Local Examinations Syndicate Cambridge Assessment was established as the University of Cambridge Local Examinations Syndicate (UCLES) by the University of Cambridge in 1858. We were set up to administer local examinations for students who were not members of the University of Cambridge, with the aim of raising standards in education. We also inspected schools. Today, we develop and deliver examinations and tests in 170 countries.Source: {Cambridge Assessment|http://www.cambridgeassessment.org.uk/about-us/who-we-are/our-h... DFE

University for Industry Ufi was created in 1998 as the University for Industry and is a Department for Business, Innovation and Skills-supported organisation, although it is not an NDPB. Ufi is the organisation responsible for the operation of Learndirect across England, Wales and Northern Ireland, and UK online centres in England. Remit Ufis remit is: to be a technologically innovative and entrepreneurial force in the improvement of skills for work to focus on the lower skilled and smaller businesses in a way whi... DFE
University Grants Committee The University Grants Committee was an advisory committee of the British government, which advised on the distribution of grant funding amongst the British universities. It was in existence from 1919 until 1989. Its functions have now largely been taken over by the higher education funding councils.Source: {Wikipedia|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_Grants_Committee_(United_Kingdom)} accessed 2019-06-17 DFE

Universal Infant Free School Meals The Children and Families Act 2014 places a legal duty on all state-funded schools in England, including academies and free schools to offer a free school lunch to all pupils in reception, year 1 and year 2 from September 2014.Source: {GOV.UK|https://www.gov.uk/universal-infant-free-school-meals-guide-for-schools-and-local-authorities} accessed 2015-06-11 DFE

As the National Agency, managed on behalf of the UK Government, UK NARIC provide the only official source of information on international education and training systems and qualifications and skills attained outside the UK. Unique Learner Numbers A ULN is a 10-digit reference number which is used alongside and to access the Personal Learning Record of anyone over the age of 14 involved in UK education or training. United Nations International Year of Youth On 18 December 2009, the United Nations General Assembly adopted a resolution A/RES/64/134 proclaiming the year commencing on 12 August 2010 as the International Year of Youth: Dialogue and Mutual Understanding. The Year will coincide with the 25th anniversary of the first International Youth Year in 1985 on the theme Participation, Development and Peace. The resolution A/RES/64/134: https://undocs.org/A/RES/64/134Source: {UN|https://social.un.org/youthyear/} accessed 2019-06-14 DFE

Universities Superannuation Scheme DFE
University technical colleges University technical colleges (UTCs) are all-ability and mixed gender state funded schools, independent of local authorities. They are not extensions of or conversions from existing provision, but new 14 to 19 academies, typically with 500-800 pupils. UTCs specialise in subjects that need modern, technical, industry-standard equipment, such as engineering and construction, and teach these disciplines alongside business skills and a broad, general education.Source: {GOV.UK|https://www.gov.uk/g... DFE
UCAS Teacher Training UTT is a single admissions system for postgraduate teacher training, covering Higher Education, SCITT, School Direct and School Direct (salaried) programmes.Source: {UCAS|https://www.ucas.com/corporateews-and-key-documentsews/ucas-teacher-training-first-monthly-statistics-published} accessed 2015-06-11 DFE

Voluntary Aided Source: The Knowledge accessed 2019-03-04 DFE
Value-Added/Distance Travelled The Learner Achievement Tracker (LAT) was a piece of software for tracking learner progress that the LSC made available to all its providers. Part of the measures of success initiative, the LAT was intended to help providers measure qualification success rate (QSR), recognising and recording progress and achievement (RARPA) and value-added/distance travelled (VA/DT).Source: The Knowledge accessed 2019-04-17 DFE
Voluntary aided schools Voluntary-aided (VA) schools are maintained schools and often, but not always, have a religious character. These schools are eligible for capital funding by grant from the department.Source: {GOV.UK|https://www.gov.uk/voluntary-aided-schools-capital-funding} accessed 2015-06-11 DFE
Voluntary-aided schools information system The voluntary-aided schools information system (VASIS) is a password-controlled site for VA schools, LAs and dioceses to access information about projects, claims and allocations.Source: {GOV.UK|https://www.gov.uk/guidance/voluntary-aided-schools-capital-funding} accessed 2018-06-13 DFE

Violence Against Woman and Girls The range of different ways violence is targetted at Woman and Girls and the strategies to tackle. Civil Service Wide Policy
Vetting and Barring Scheme The Vetting and Barring Scheme (VBS) went live on 12 October 2009. The scheme is delivered by the Criminal Records Bureau (CRB) and the Independent Safeguarding Authority (ISA) under the Safeguarding and Vulnerable Groups Act 2006. VBS covers England, Wales and Northern Ireland; a separate but aligned scheme was implemented in Scotland in 2010. DFE

Vocational Certificate of Education The Vocational Certificate of Education (VCE) was introduced in September 2000 to replace the advanced General National Vocational Qualification. Following a review, VCEs were renamed GCEs (General Certificates of Education) in applied subjects or A Levels in applied subjects. The revised qualifications, which were introduced in September 2005, provide a broad introduction to vocational areas and encourage teaching and assessment approaches in work-related contexts.Source: The Knowledge acces... DFE
Voluntary and Community Sector The Voluntary and Community Sector (VCS) is an umbrella term that covers a very diverse range of providers who are working with a specific voluntary or community aim. The sector is large and varied. It is made up of charities and voluntary groups as well as informal community-based organisations. Members of the sector can vary from international, well-known companies with thousands of paid staff, to small community groups with no paid staff.Source: The Knowledge accessed 2019-03-04 DFE

Virtual Education Action Zones Virtual Education Action Zones (VEAZ) were introduced by the Department for Education and Employment in 1999. They were an innovative build-on to Education Action Zones and were designed to explore the improvements that could be achieved using information technology - with the schools set to be connected by video-conferencing and e-mail. Each of the participating schools had video-conferencing equipment installed, with access to e-mail improved for pupils and the 1,000 teachers and support st... DFE
Vocational Education and Training DFE
Vetinary Quality Assurance (VET QA, the S is part of assurance) A commercial service that APHA (part of Defra) offer to labs worldwide that test the quality of labs that test animal samples. It's a test of a test in plain English. We call these tests Proficiency Tests and VETQAS are an ISO accredited leader in this field. APHA, Defra APHA Scientific
Value For Money Good value for money is the optimal use of resources to achieve the intended outcomes. â€˜Optimalâ€™ means â€˜the most desirable possible given expressed or implied restrictions or constraintsâ€™. Value for money is not about achieving the lowest initial price. Civil Service Wide

Violent and Sex Offender Register ViSOR is a secure national database that can be accessed by the Police, Probation, and Prison services, allowing the three services to work on the same system to help reduce reoffending. This is being replaced by MAPPS (see above) MoJ
Virtual Learning Environment A Virtual Learning Environment (VLE) is an ICT-based environment that supports the delivery of online learning. VLEs allow controlled access to pieces of information, which can be individually assessed and recorded. VLEs also allow the tracking of student activity and progress, support of online learning, and electronic communication between the learner, tutor and others. The teacher and student have two different access levels: the teacher can see what the student sees, but has additional us... Not Limited to CS

Wales Office
Workforce Agreement Monitoring Group The Workforce Agreement Monitoring Group (WAMG) was a social partnership of 11 organisations representing employers, the government and school workforce unions. It was formed in 2003 to monitor implementation of the national agreement. It ended in 2010. The group worked collaboratively on the wider workforce reform agenda with a common purpose of supporting schools in raising standards and tackling workload issues for staff.Source: The Knowledge accessed 2019-03-04 DFE

Workforce Race Advisory Group The Workforce Race Advisory Group (WRAG) grew out of the Commission for Black Staff in Further Education as an advisory body for the Department for Education and Skills (DfES); it is now part of Department for Business, Innovation and Skills. It was set up to ensure the leaders of national partner organisations and learning providers had a mechanism to advise the DfES on the issues of race equality as they impact on the sector's workforce. Name of an LAA database schema. According to old rules, XX is the standard prefix for customization in EBS (E-Business Suite). MoJ
Young Apprentice Ambassador Network The Young Apprenticeship Ambassador Network (YAAN) is a group of past and current apprentices that are members of a local YAAN in their region. The core purpose of the YAAN is to grow and expand the apprenticeship programme by engaging with and providing information on apprenticeships to young people through a number of different activities and events, including schools/6th forms and young people in school academic years 11-13. The role of the ambassador is to promote apprenticeships and insp... DFE
Youth Cohort Study A series of longitudinal surveys that contacts a sample of an academic year-group or "cohort" of young people in the spring following completion of education and usually annually until they are aged 19 or 20. The survey looks at young people's education and labour market experience, their training and qualifications and a wide range of other issues, including socio-demographic variables.Source: DfE RS Gateway as at 2011-01-17 DFE

Young Fathers Initiative The Young Fathers Initiative is a registered charity supported by the Department for Education that aims to: -remove barriers that currently stop young father's involvement in family life; -ensure that young fathers are informed and have the skills required to father their children well; -support children's development, by supporting the active involvement of young fathers; -provide professionals with information, advice and support to develop their work with young fathers. The Institute pla... DFE

Youth Justice Board The Youth Justice Board for England and Wales (YJB) is an executive NDPB. Board members are appointed by the Secretary of State for Justice. The YJB oversees the youth justice system in England and Wales. Source: {Ministry of Justice website|http://www.justice.gov.uk/about/yjb/} accessed 2015-06-11 MoJ

Youth offending teams There is a YOT in every local authority in England and Wales. They are made up of representatives from the police, Probation Service, social services, health, education, drugs and alcohol misuse and housing officers. Young Persons Guarantee DFE
Young Peoples Learning Agency Launched April 2010. Sponsored by the Department for Education to support the delivery of training and education to all 16-19 year olds in England. From April 1st 2012 the responsibilities of the YPLA have transferred to the Education Funding Agency. DFE
Young Persons Matched Admin Data YPMAD covers the attainment of 16-19 year olds (including some information on older ages) in England and also captures information on pupil characteristics. It is a longitudinal dataset which allows students' progress to be tracked. YPMAD is generated by matching several data sources (school census, awarding organisation and individualised learner record data). YPMAD is used to underpin the National Statistics output Level 2 and 3 attainment by young people aged 19, which is used to estimate ... DFE
Year round education DFE
Youth Rehabilitation Order The Youth Rehabilitation Order (YRO) came into effect on 30 November 2009 and will provide judges and magistrates with a choice of 18 rigorous options from which they will be able to create a sentence specifically designed to deal with the individual circumstances of the young offender before them and so help them turn their backs on crime. The YRO will consolidate and enhance existing community sentences to enable courts to sentence in a flexible and tailored way. The YRO provides a range of... DFE
Youth Sector Development Fund The Youth Sector Development Fund (YSDF) has been set up to provide a direct response to the commitments in Aiming High for Young People/Aiming High for young people: a ten year strategy for positive activities to build the capacity of third sector organisations. The YSDF will support third sector organisations (TSOs) that can demonstrate effective approaches to engaging and empowering young people, particularly the most disadvantaged. From April 2008, up to 100 million will be available to p... DFE

Youth Treatment Centre DFE
Youth Training Scheme 1983/1986. One year scheme. It was introduced in September 1983, and the training period was extended to 2 years in April 1986. The scheme was replaced by Youth Training (YT) in April 1990. Source: The Knowledge accessed 2019-02-05 DFE
Young Volunteer Challenge Pilot scheme ran 2003-05. Through the Young Volunteer Challenge pilot (YVC) a young person will have the opportunity to do some volunteering work after they leave school. The pilot is being run in 9 areas within England until September 2005, and offers opportunities for 820 young people for whom finance is the main barrier to participate in volunteering. This full-time initiative (full-time is defined as more than 30 hours per week) will target 18 and 19 year olds who have completed their pro... DFE

Statutory Instruments The most common form of secondary legislation. SIs usually follow affirmative or negative procedure, or have no procedure at all, this and their scope, is fixed by the Act of Parliament under which they are made. DBT TPIN
Commercial Continuous Improvement Assessment Framework The Commercial Continuous Improvement Assessment Framework is designed to help drive continuous improvement in commercial practices across the public sector. Civil Service Wide Standards and Continuous Improvement
Law Officers' Departments The Attorney General and Solicitor General (the Law Officers) have overall responsibility for the work of: Crown Prosecution Service (CPS); HM Crown Prosecution Service Inspectorate (HMCPSI); Government Legal Department (GLD); Serious Fraud Office (SFO). Together with the Attorney Generalâ€™s Office (AGO), these departments are known as the Law Officersâ€™ Departments (LODs). LODs
